ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.description:
hickle is a neat, quick way of dumping python variables to HDF5 files that can be read
in most programming languages. Hickle is fast, and allows for transparent
compression of your data (LZF / GZIP). Hickle is built upon h5py, and can be used as a
drop-in replacement for pickle/cPickle.
about.summary: A HDF5-based python pickle replacement for dumping and loading python variables to file.

about.description:
hickle is a neat, quick way of dumping python variables to HDF5 files that can be read
in most programming languages. Hickle is fast, and allows for transparent
compression of your data (LZF / GZIP). Hickle is built upon h5py, and can be used as a
drop-in replacement for pickle/cPickle.
about.summary: A HDF5-based python pickle replacement for dumping and loading python variables to file.

name: hickle
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "5.0.3" %}

package:
  name: hickle
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/h/hickle/hickle-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 027e51ccad279d168123a244525e6c84bac0db64605b311b0bd349891be0c53e

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 2

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - numpy >=1.8,!=1.20
    - h5py >=2.10.0

test:
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}
  imports:
    - hickle
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: http://github.com/telegraphic/hickle
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'A HDF5-based python pickle replacement for dumping and loading python variables to file.'

  description: |
    hickle is a neat, quick way of dumping python variables to HDF5 files that can be read 
    in most programming languages. Hickle is fast, and allows for transparent 
    compression of your data (LZF / GZIP). Hickle is built upon h5py, and can be used as a
    drop-in replacement for pickle/cPickle.
  doc_url: http://github.com/telegraphic/hickle/README.md
  dev_url: https://github.com/telegraphic/hickle

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - telegraphic
    - jan-janssen
